Message.Title: Out of memory in cfg
Message.Description: There is not enough memory in the cfg database for this operation.
Message.Consequences: The configuration file will not be installed.
Message.Actions:
1) Try to use the option: delete existing parameters before loading
when loading the configuration file. This will delete all previous configuration settings for the domain.
2) Increase the size of the configuration database.

Message.Title: Instance can not be saved
Message.Description: Not allowed to overwrite instance in line of file .
Message.Consequences: The instance may be write protected and the configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Actions: You are not allowed to change the instance.

Message.Title: Wrong domain version or incorrect file
Message.Description: The cfg domain version of file is wrong. The software is made for version .
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Actions: 1) Re-edit the configuration file, and change the version of the cfg domain.

Message.Title: Line too long
Message.Description: Line in file contains characters, which is more than the allowed .
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Actions: 1) Re-edit the configuration file and reduce the number of characters, e.g. by splitting the instance into several lines. End each line, except the last one, with a trailing backslash "\" to achieve this.

Message.Title: Attribute value out of allowed range
Message.Description: Attribute on line in file is out of the allowed range. The allowed range is < > - < >.
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Actions: 1) Re-edit the configuration file and change the value on the attribute to fit inside the allowed range.

Message.Title: Instance name occupied
Message.Description: Instance in line in file is already occupied.
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Actions:
1) Re-edit the configuration file and change the instance name to add it to the file OR
2) Use the "Replace" mode to overwrite the instance previously using the name. This may be selected when loading the configuration file using RobotStudio, and the procedure is detailed in the RobotStudio Manual.

Message.Title: Unknown type or attribute in cfg file
Message.Description: Type/attribute in position on line of file is not recognized.
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Causes: The configuration type may not be installed, illegal/mistyped attribute, or the name is too long.

Message.Title: Mandatory attribute is missing in cfg file
Message.Description: Missing mandatory attribute on line in file .
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.

Message.Title: Missing instance name in cfg file
Message.Description: Missing instance name on line in file .
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.

Message.Title: Configuration attribute value out of the allowed range
Message.Description: Configuration attribute on line in file is out of the allowed range. The max. allowed length is characters.
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Actions: 1) Re-edit the configuration file and change the value on the attribute to fit inside the allowed range.

Message.Title: Illegal version string
Message.Description: The version string in configuration file has illegal format.
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Causes:
The configuration file is made for a different system version/revision.
The version string in the configuration file is mistyped/missing.
The configuration file is corrupted.
Message.Actions:
1) Re-edit the configuration file and change the version string according to this layout:
"domain":"cfg domain version":"version":"revision"::.

Message.Title: Illegal domain name
Message.Description: The domain name in configuration file is illegal.
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Causes: The domain name may be mistyped or the domain is not installed in the system.
Message.Actions: 1) Re-edit the configuration file and change the domain name.
